pullRequest.body:
This adds definitions of linear equivalences for modules `M` with their left-/right-product with a trivial module `M \times 0` and `0 \times M`, and analogous statements for Algebras.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

nodes.body: :v: LukasMias can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).

Coming here from issue triage: it seems this PR is basically ready to go, except for merge conflicts.
Would you like help with these?

bors d+

I pushed some cleanups. Let's leave the inconsistency to resolve in future, the cross-references are enough for now.

bors d+

I pushed some cleanups. Let's leave the inconsistency to resolve in future, the cross-references are enough for now.

```suggestion
/-- Multiplying by the trivial module from the left does not change the structure.

This is the linear version of `AddEquiv.uniqueProd`. -/
```
And same throughout, since this creates links in the web documentation.

Let's link the strongest weaker equivalence:
```suggestion
This is the `AlgebraEquiv` version of `LinearEquiv.uniqueProd`. -/
```
Ideally we'd mention`RingEquiv.uniqueProd` too, but I assume that's also missing.

[RingEquiv.prodZeroRing](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Algebra/Ring/Prod.html#RingEquiv.prodZeroRing) and [RingEquiv.zeroRingProd](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Algebra/Ring/Prod.html#RingEquiv.zeroRingProd) exist, but they use the condition `[Subsingleton S]` rather than `[Unique S]`. Any thoughts on whether we'd like these to be more consistent with one another? In any case, probably worth referencing them to one another for ease of use.

The naming discrepancy sounds like a question for Zulip.
Using `Subsingleton` instead of `Unique` does seem sensible here.
(I'm happy to merge as is with a reference to the inconsistent ring name, if you'd prefer to do this in two steps)

Opened a Zulip thread about that [here.](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/287929-mathlib4/topic/prodZeroRing.20vs.20prodUnique) I'll already commit a change to make them refer to one another tho

pullRequest.title: feat(Algebra/Algebra/Prod): add prodUnique and uniqueProd for LinearEquiv and AlgebraEquiv
